__data__.text:
3. INTRODUCTION

 3.1. Objectives, Background and Drivers

CBD aims to transform its mobile app into a daily financial companion by integrating Conversational Banking Agent (Post-login user interface for natural language banking interactions), which in certain App sections could be easily enabled with “swipe up” gesture. With limited number of actions clients can immediately start conversations about their account's insights (scope of MVP1), which will follow with possibilities to execute actions from payment transactions (repeat payment, report transaction) and investment account advisor (scope of MVP2 and MVP3).

BRD Post-Login Agentic chatbot with Dyna.AI, Version 1.12

__data__.text:
Classification: Internal
Business Requirement Document (BRD)

A successful POC by Digital team was conducted with Dyna.AI, demonstrating the effectiveness of Conversational Banking Agents in banking and wealth advisory. The Banking Agent showed enhanced accuracy and personalization using enriched transaction data, while the Wealth Advisor Agent delivered insightful portfolio analysis and performance tracking, validating its capability to interpret complex financial data.

Multiple studies12345 show that Conversational Banking Agents can transform a bank’s mobile App from a transactional utility into a daily financial companion. With this project CBD goal is to be one of the first players to act on agentic transition delivering high value services for the client with Conversational Banking Agents. Market studies suggest that introducing Conversational Banking Agents could boost monthly active mobile customers by up to 20%12, double digital engagement2, and increase Mobile NPS by 6–10 points34.

Today, Chatbot (Pre-login support interface (e.g., Aysha 2.0) for general inquiries and FAQs) users with product and process knowledge. The upcoming Dyna.ai integration will introduce Agentic AI Agents (Autonomous GenAI-powered entity capable of interpreting inputs and initiating banking actions), enabling deeper insights and contextual actions. Specialized agents (Functional modules within the Agentic AI system (e.g., Financial Advisor, Payment Advisor)) will collaborate to meet customer needs. Existing Chatbot in the future could be retrained as another Agentic AI Agent and become a part of Conversational Banking Agent (not scope of this BRD).

3.2. Project Scope

The Bank will integrate Conversational Banking Agent into its mobile banking application to enhance customer engagement, provide 24/7 self-service, and improve operational efficiency. Agentic AI Agents will be powered by a Dyna-hosted SaaS, providing secure, scalable, and rapid deployment capabilities.

- Provide instant, accurate responses to customer inquiries via the bank’s mobile app.
- Enhance personalization in transaction advisory and financial advisory through AI-driven insights.
- Enable automated execution of payment and transfers.
- Maintain compliance with local and international data privacy regulations like UAE PDPL, CBUAE’s AI rulebook, ISO 27701.
- Support multilingual customer base with seamless switching between English, Arabic, Hindi, Urdu, Malayalam, Farsi, Russian, and Tagalog.

 Suggested operational model of the solution:

To minimize any operational and fraud risks, it is suggested that system works in following way

1. User in CBD Mobile App uses pre-defined action to initiate conversation with the chat. Potential examples (exact ones will be finalized during testing phase):

BRD Post-Login Agentic chatbot with Dyna.AI, Version 1.12

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

Action is requested from Dyna.AI Agentic AI Agent

1. Dyna.AI requests from CBD Transaction database all relevant transaction information
2. CBD Database returns Data set of particular customer transactions to Agentic AI Agent
3. Agentic AI Agent returns answer to the customer and continues conversation around defined topics

For MVP2: make possibility to execute actions from payment

This is continuation of MVP1 journey only at the end and after reviewing list of transactions, customer is having opportunity to repeat similar payment, report transaction from merchant and other defined during the tests.

In this situation After Step 4 and conversation, instead of having the Agentic AI Agent directly initiate an API call to the bank’s payment rails, we propose redirecting the customer to a payment or transfer summary screen where they can review and confirm the transaction. After payment completion, the customer should be returned to the Agentic AI Agent screen.

This approach applies across all business rails, including:

- local transfers (IPP/IPI for instant, FTS for standard)
- international transfers (instant via SBI, Thunes, Hello Paisa; standard via SWIFT)
- other bank credit card payments (typically FTS)
- AANI payments, which also run on IPP rails
- AANI transfers, which should be coming in November 2025

To minimize the risks associated with fraud, initially maximum amount of payment size should be limited for example to 500 Dirhams.

 3.2.2. Out of Scope

Retail Internet Bank (RIB) is out of scope and focus is on Mobile Application only.

 3.3. Assumptions, Constraints and Risks

 3.3.1. Assumptions

 Vendor Hosting & Maintenance

The Conversational Banking agent will be hosted, maintained, and continuously improved by the vendor in a secure SaaS environment.

 Bank API Availability

The Bank will provide secure and stable API endpoints to enable real-time integration with internal systems.

 Data Privacy Compliance

Vendor will ensure compliance with local data residency laws (e.g., UAE PDPL, CBUA regulations)

 Integration Readiness

The bank’s mobile application architecture supports integration with external SaaS Agentic AI Agents services via APIs and SDKs.

 Lune Readiness

Lune integration will be live and all historical transactions will be enriched in production before the chatbot is launched.

 4. Guardrails:

Outputs are subjected to business and compliance guardrails, including security and policy enforcement layers, to ensure that responses remain aligned with regulatory, legal, and organizational requirements.

 5. Compliance and Auditability:

All outputs are traceable and auditable, supporting both automated and manual reviews. This provides transparency into model reasoning and ensures accountability, while enabling continuous improvement of compliance posture.

By embedding these multi-layer safeguards, the system achieves a balance between innovation and risk control, ensuring responsible AI usage in line with globally recognized compliance frameworks.

Can a situation of excessive demand (high number of live sessions) or architectural weaknesses in the bot's design may result in system outages, thereby rendering banking services inaccessible to legitimate users?

controls Chat at initial stage will be limited to pre-defined prompts only and will be able to disclose information only within defined prompt.

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

 Agent

1. Agentic AI Agent works with data set retrieved for user and doesn’t keep customer transaction information in its database.
2. DynaAI Database is used only for statistical purposes.

 Risk that by error or intentionally by customer big amount transfer is initiated

Will be mitigated by two factors:

1. Max payment value will be capped.
2. Frequency of payments also needs to be decided.
3. Allowed payment scenarios will be discussed and tested with minimal risk impact in mind.

 Elderly individuals or users lacking experience may unintentionally fall a victim by initiating high-risk transactions or disclosing sensitive information without fully grasping the associated consequences (such as granting permission to invest their entire savings in high-risk assets)

We will limit transaction amount at start to ensure we are not exposing people to high value transactions using new functionality.

 Can the bot fail to function as intended due to software defects, design flaws, or unforeseen operational circumstances

Highly unlikely, as data set is limited to customers transactions on current account and / or investment account and models are trained to certain quality level to deliver insights. Also at launch models will be limited to pre-defined prompts for Transactions history and Investments history / ability to drill down details within pre-defined prompt.

 Can there be a possibility of logical errors within the bot, which may cause misinterpretation of user instructions, execution of incorrect transactions, or omission of critical verification steps (e.g., a user requests payment of a utility bill, but the bot remits an incorrect amount or processes)

Same as previous responses, ie prompts will be limited to pre-defined prompts and customer history. Transfers will follow existing payment authorisation as per APIs available and will execute only payment by payment.

__data__.text:
BRD Post-Login

Agentic chatbot with Dyna.AI, Version 1.12

Classification: Internal

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

between bank and SaaS supplier - should be mitigated by proper 3ʳᵈ party assessment and acceptance testing

 4. BUSINESS PROCESS OVERVIEW

 4.1. Current Business Process (As-Is)

Currently we have Aysha 2.0 AI powered chatbot, with the capability to generate responses in real time ensuring more dynamic, context aware and humanlike interactions. This Chatbot platform is integrated on top of Azure Open AI services. Knowledge for information for the bot comes from our corporate website content, special FAQs and published documents.

 4.2. Proposed Business Process (To-Be)

Proposal is to use Aysha2.0 only for the public channel. Integrate Dyna.AI SDK to the mobile application and prepare Conversational Banking agent based on the customer data qualified on digital layer. In the future there is an option to create a new Agentic AI Agent and retrain it in on publicly available content (Aysha) and provide this general knowledge data as part of Conversational Banking Agent to authenticated users.

 4.3. Gaps Identification

- a) Fragmented Customer Experience: Aysha 2.0 only supports pre-login interactions, leaving post-login and support journeys disconnected. Customers receive inconsistent responses across channels (web, app, call centre), leading to confusion and reduced trust.
- b) Siloed Technology Stacks: different personas (public users, customers, staff, agents) rely on separate platforms (Aysha SDK, Genesys, Dyna.AI), each with its own APIs and data sources. Lack of unified orchestration results in duplicated efforts and integration complexity.
- c) Limited Personalization: without a centralized AI engine, personalization is shallow or absent. Previous customer conversation are not persistent.
- d) Inconsistent Knowledge Base: FAQs, indexed documents, and site map content are not synchronized across channels. Internal staff and call centre agents could rely on outdated or incomplete SOPs.
- e) Compliance and Data Residency Risks: multiple platforms handling PII without unified governance increase the risk of non-compliance with UAE Central Bank regulations.

 5. BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS

 Customer-Centric Experience

Deliver an intuitive, human-like interaction chatbot for common and complex banking queries.

 Customer Engagement & Retention

Increase in-app engagement time through proactive financial advice and service prompts.

BRD Post-Login Agentic chatbot with Dyna.AI, Version 1.12 16

5.3. Key testing scenarios

Including but not limited to:

- Test for performance / errors / lags / hang-ups.
- Test for accuracy of responses
- Test for account statement accuracy

BRD Post-Login Agentic chatbot with Dyna.AI, Version 1.12 19

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

• Test to assure Conversational Banking Agent doesn’t inadvertently disclose sensitive information

• Test for completeness of responses

• Test for helpfulness of responses

• Test for response consistency and satiability

• Test whether Q&A function in the AI Solution is working

Plan for continuous testing - we plan to work on the monitoring tool, to ensure that any new deployments / changes to the content and or model result in the same quality as per POC conducted. | Risk of DynaAI providing incorrect or inaccurate information to the customer | To ensure seamless and natural interactions, maximize user engagement, and support users in achieving their communication objectives, our solution is designed based on large language models. As this is inherently a probabilistic approach, there is a potential risk of generating inaccurate content. To mitigate this risk, we have implemented a comprehensive, end-to-end control framework, aligned with industry best practices and regulatory standards:1) **Model Layer:** The deployed models undergo reinforcement learning specifically focused on factual adherence. This table outlines the functional requirements for a Conversational Banking Agent, detailing various features and capabilities such as initiating the agent from different app sections, handling customer queries, integrating with banking APIs, and ensuring data privacy and security.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/child: None
- Description: None

| Req#   | Priority | Parent/child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-001 | 1        | Parent       | An active customer should be able to initiate Conversational Banking Agent (swipe-up) from different section of the app and see corresponding contextual Agentic AI Agent opened (Banking Agent, Investment Agent, Payment Agent) |
| FR-002 | 1        | Parent       | Customer should be able to see default prompts in each of the Agentic AI Agent screens. The default prompts for each section will be defined during design phase                                                                  |
| FR-003 | 1        | Child        | Customer should be able to select one of the default prompts in the screen                                                                                                                                                        |
| FR-004 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent will use by default 3 months of data to respond for the default prompts                                                                                                                              |
| FR-005 | 1        | Parent       | Customer should be able to ask follow-up questions in defined context of the prompt with memory of previous response. Should be able to extend timeframe of questions to 1 year.                                                  |
| FR-006 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should resort to default prompts or fallback responses if the follow-up questions are out of context (config will be defined)                                                                        |
| FR-007 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent shall handle customer queries using natural language understanding.                                                                                                                                  |
| FR-008 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should always mask sensitive details (like PI) in the responses                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-009 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should always answer questions in the context of customer financial transactions and should not generate or hallucinate responses                                                                    |
| FR-010 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should never access or reveal another customer information                                                                                                                                           |
| FR-011 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent shall integrate with banking APIs:                                                                                                                                                                   |
|        |          |              | a) account data retrieval; b) transaction history list; c) payment initiation; d) report fraudulent transaction; e) provide list of investments including their performance; other – defined during development phase             |
| FR-012 | 1        | Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent shall support real-time                                                                                                                                                                              |

with the following columns:

| Req#   | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-013 |1| Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent shall provide personalized financial insights based on transaction history.                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| FR-014 |1| Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent shall provide personalized financial insights based on customer’s investment appetite.                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| FR-015 |1| Parent       | Customer has a chance to rate conversation with the Conversational Banking Agent (thumbs up/thumbs down).                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| FR-016 |1| Parent       | Chats are stored for 2 weeks to review quality of responses.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| FR-017 |1| Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should log chats and transactions for quality and review.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| FR-018 |1| Child        | Swipe-up gesture doesn’t work from other screens not related to topics (will be defined by Design team during Design phase. Main principle – MVP1 can be initiated from transaction list screen, while Investments Agent – from future Investment Balance status screen).                                                           |
| FR-019 |1| Parent       | There should be message or screen in case Agentic AI Agent doesn’t work on Dyna.AI side. Customer can normally resolve this without closing App.                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| FR-020 |1| Parent       | Conversational Banking Agent should gracefully handle API failures or timeouts - Initially Agent will provide message, that it can not perform particular request. Team who will monitor and analyze usage reports can later introduce also other messages through Dyna.AI configuration module – like escalating to human support. |
